main_definition: Conferences refer to meetings or gatherings where people come together to discuss specific topics, exchange ideas, or make decisions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A series of events focused on a particular subject for information and discussion
meanings_and_examples.example: The annual Medical Conference in Boston brought doctors from around the world to discuss advancements in healthcare.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An official meeting or assembly held by organizations, governments, or institutions
meanings_and_examples.example: The United Nations Climate Change Conference was attended by representatives of 195 countries to negotiate global environmental policies.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A large gathering where experts in a field share their research and findings
meanings_and_examples.example: Scientists from all over the world gathered at the International Conference on Climate Change to present their latest research.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An event or program designed for learning, networking, and professional development
meanings_and_examples.example: The Technology Conference offered workshops, keynote speeches, and panel discussions focused on the future of technology.
